title: Monitoring, Metrics, and Runbook
summary: Define metrics, alert thresholds, and operational runbooks for common incidents.
description: Specify the minimal set of metrics (uptime, error rate, auth failures, DB errors, queue/backlog depth), provide sample alert rules, and document runbook steps for on-call responders.

components.name: Metrics List
components.responsibility: Define metric names, types, and labels to be exported (Prometheus or hosted provider).

components.name: Alert Rules
components.responsibility: Translate metrics to alert thresholds and recommended notification channels.

components.name: Runbook
components.responsibility: Step-by-step playbooks for common incidents (DB down, auth provider failure, high error rate).

interactions: Metrics exported from API and background jobs to metrics backend.
Alerts map to runbook steps and on-call contacts.
acceptance_criteria: A documented metrics list with suggested thresholds exists in `docs/`.
At least two sample alert rules and runbook entries are documented.
Health endpoints are usable in readiness/liveness configs.
tasks: Inventory existing health endpoints and metrics exporters in codebase.
Add sample Prometheus rules and one runbook play for DB unavailable.
